Award.AbstractNarration: This award will support the preparation of a report on the Third Arctic Observing Network (AON) PI Workshop that was held in Boulder, Colorado, from 30 November 2009 to 2 December 2009. The report will summarize the progress and achievements of AON during the 4th International Polar Year 2007-2009, and provide guidance on the future development of AON.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The AON PI Meeting Report summarizes the first 3 years of activities that began in 2007.  This report was created from the AON PI Meeting held in December 2009.  The report is a summary of the outcome of the working group deliberations and other important outcomes of the meeting.  It highlights the progress in the development and implementation of the observing network. It also shows progress in implementation to document the changes now ongoing in the pan-Arctic and the broad multi-disciplinary participation in the effort.

By documeting the results of the meeting, the broader impacts of the report will serve as a major tool for informing the broad science and lay communities of AON work, as well as provide access to the rich datasets that are an outcome of AON. The report will also serve as justification and background for the future evolution of AON.

The intellectual merit of the report is highlighted through a collection of short project progress reports, a summary of lessons learned during the International Polar Year (IPY), assessments of key challenges impeding AON development, recommendations for fostering international coordination and colaboration post IPY, assessment of AON data usage by both the scientific community and stakeholders, and recommendations for encouraging more widespread data use with the scientific community.  

The final draft of the AON PI meeting report was printed in July 2010.  525 copies of the report were printed. This report was widely distributed throughout the community using web access and hard copies.
